questions.question_text:
In a reaction, 5.3 g of sodium carbonate reacted with 6 g of acetic acid. The products were 2.2 g of carbon dioxide, 0.9 g water and 8.2 g of sodium acetate. Show that these observations are in agreement with the law of conservation of mass.
sodium carbonate + acetic acid → sodium acetate + carbon dioxide + water
Hydrogen and oxygen combine in the ratio of 1:8 by mass to form water. What mass of oxygen gas would be required to react completely with 3 g of hydrogen gas?
hints: Set up proportion: hydrogen mass / oxygen mass = 1/8
Solve for oxygen mass when hydrogen = 3g

questions.question_text: Which postulate of Dalton's atomic theory is the result of the law of conservation of mass?
hints: Identify which postulate aligns with 'atoms cannot be created or destroyed'

questions.question_text: Which postulate of Dalton's atomic theory can explain the law of definite proportions?
hints: Identify which postulate explains fixed composition
Relate to constant mass ratios in compounds
Define as 1/12th mass of carbon-12 atom

questions.question_text: Why is it not possible to see an atom with naked eyes?
hints: Compare with wavelength of visible light

questions.question_text: Write down the formulae of (i) sodium oxide (ii) aluminium chloride (iii) sodium sulphide (iv) magnesium hydroxide
Write down the names of compounds represented by the following formulae: (i) Al2(SO4)3 (ii) CaCl2 (iii) K2SO4 (iv) KNO3 (v) CaCO3
What is meant by the term chemical formula?
hints: Include element symbols and atom counts

questions.question_text: How many atoms are present in a (i) H2S molecule and (ii) PO43– ion?
hints: Count atoms in H2S: H=2, S=1
Count atoms in PO43-: P=1, O=4

questions.question_text: Calculate the molecular masses of H2, O2, Cl2, CO2, CH4, C2H6, C2H4, NH3, CH3OH.
hints: Use atomic masses: H=1, C=12, O=16, N=14, Cl=35.5
Sum atomic masses of all atoms in molecule
Multiply atomic mass by number of atoms

questions.question_text: Calculate the formula unit masses of ZnO, Na2O, K2CO3, given atomic masses of Zn = 65 u, Na = 23 u, K = 39 u, C = 12 u, and O = 16 u.
hints: Sum atomic masses of all atoms in formula unit
For ionic compounds, treat same as molecular mass

questions.question_text: A 0.24 g sample of compound of oxygen and boron was found by analysis to contain 0.096 g of boron and 0.144 g of oxygen. Calculate the percentage composition of the compound by weight.
hints: Calculate for boron and oxygen separately

questions.question_text: When 3.0 g of carbon is burnt in 8.00 g oxygen, 11.00 g of carbon dioxide is produced. What mass of carbon dioxide will be formed when 3.00 g of carbon is burnt in 50.00 g of oxygen? Which law of chemical combination will govern your answer?
hints: Calculate based on fixed C:O ratio in CO2

questions.question_text: What are polyatomic ions? Give examples.
hints: Define as groups of atoms with net charge

questions.question_text: Write the chemical formulae of the following. (a) Magnesium chloride (b) Calcium oxide (c) Copper nitrate (d) Aluminium chloride (e) Calcium carbonate.
Give the names of the elements present in the following compounds. (a) Quick lime (b) Hydrogen bromide (c) Baking powder (d) Potassium sulphate.

Calculate the molar mass of the following substances. (a) Ethyne, C2H2 (b) Sulphur molecule, S8 (c) Phosphorus molecule, P4 (Atomic mass of phosphorus = 31) (d) Hydrochloric acid, HCl (e) Nitric acid, HNO3
hints: Sum atomic masses of all atoms
